Risk: LLM-generated code can contain subtle bugs or incorrect logic that is incorporated into research software without adequate review, potentially leading to erroneous results in published research.
Mitigations: Treat AI-generated code with the same review standards as human-written code. Ensure test coverage includes edge cases that LLMs commonly mishandle. Document where AI tools were used in development.
Ownership: Individual RSEs and researchers, research software teams, institutions providing AI coding tools.
Examples: The University of Oxford policy on Generative AI in research specifies "generating code" as substantive use of GenAI, and suggest human judgement is required in all substantive interactions. https://www.ox.ac.uk/research/support-researchers/research-practice/policy-generative-ai-research
